questions.text: Of its 30 known isotopes, how many are stable?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Only I-127 is stable and found in nature. The artificial radioisotope I-131, with a half-life of 8 days, has been used in treating the thyroid gland.

questions.text: In the presence of starches, what color does iodine turn?
questions.explanation:
blue.

	Put some iodine on a cut potato.

questions.text: With what group is iodine associated?
questions.explanation:
Halogens.

	Iodine exhibits some metallic-like properties, but is in the halogen group. It is less active than the other halogens, which displace it from iodides.
